item.title: Turkey Abruptly Closes Espionage Trial of 2 Journalists to Public
item.description: The move was criticized by journalists and anti-government and human rights activists who wondered if the defendants could receive a fair trial.
item.dc:creator: CEYLAN YEGINSU
item.media:description: From left, Can Dundar, the top editor at Cumhuriyet, a Turkish daily, and Erdem Gul, its Ankara editor, arrived at a courthouse Friday in Istanbul for their trial on espionage charges.

item.title: Frank Deng, ‘Spirited’ Chinese Entrepreneur and Brussels Victim
item.description: Deng Jingquan, also known as Frank Deng, had founded in Internet start-up not long after finishing college.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: Deng Jingquan, also known as Frank Deng, was a technology entrepreneur and frequent traveler.

item.title: Najim Laachraoui, 24, Bomb Maker for Paris and Brussels Attacks
item.description: What is known about a former engineering student who blew himself up at Brussels Airport on March 22.
item.dc:creator: LILIA BLAISE and AURELIEN BREEDEN
item.media:description: A man the Belgian police said was Najim Laachraoui in an undated photo posted by the agency on Twitter.

item.title: Headed to U.S. for a Belated Celebration, Jennifer Scintu-Waetzmann Dies in Brussels Attacks
item.description: Jennifer Scintu-Waetzmann and her husband were traveling to New York City for their first anniversary. She died in the attack, and he is in a coma.
item.dc:creator: DANIEL VICTOR
item.media:description: Jennifer Scintu-Waetzmann in a photo taken from social media.

item.title: André Adam, Retired Diplomat and Brussels Victim
item.description: A foreign service career that included posts with the United Nations and in the United States, Africa, Europe and Cuba.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY and ELI ROSENBERG
item.media:description: André Adam, a retired ambassador, was on his way to the United States on Tuesday when he was killed in the attack at Brussels Airport.

item.title: Opinion: Please Cancel Your Vacation to North Korea
item.description: Americans don’t get dictatorships. They don’t know to be afraid.
item.dc:creator: MARIE MYUNG-OK LEE
item.media:description: A scene in Kaesong, North Korea, punctuated by a propaganda billboard.

item.title: In Brussels Bombing Plot, a Trail of Dots Not Connected
item.description: Only on the morning of the attacks did chemical odors and other strange hints come together to form a clear picture of what had been happening at the apartment used as a bomb-making workshop.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA
item.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak for The New York Times
item.media:description: A girl sitting against the old stock exchange in Brussels, where messages were written in chalk in memory of the victims of the suicide bombings on Tuesday.

item.title: In Belgian Plot, a Trail of Dots Not Connected
item.description: Only on the morning of the attacks did chemical odors and other strange hints come together to form a clear picture of what had been happening at the apartment used as a bomb-making workshop.
item.dc:creator: ANDREW HIGGINS and KIMIKO DE FREYTAS-TAMURA
item.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak for The New York Times
item.media:description: A girl sitting against the old stock exchange in Brussels, where messages were written in chalk in memory of the victims of the suicide bombings on Tuesday.

item.title: Possible Pilot Error Is Cited in FlyDubai Crash in Russia
item.description: The pilots turned off autopilot, Russian state television said, but may have accidentally turned on a stabilizing fin, leading to a loss of control.
item.dc:creator: IVAN NECHEPURENKO

item.title: New Brussels Attack Suspect Is Charged, Prosecutors Say
item.description: A man identified in the Belgian press as Fayçal Cheffou has been accused of terrorist murders. The authorities say he was deeply involved in the plot.
item.dc:creator: ALISSA J. RUBIN

item.title: North Korean Propaganda Video Depicts Nuclear Strike on Washington
item.description: The video uploaded Saturday includes a warning to “American imperialists” not to provoke the North.
item.dc:creator: CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Sweep Leads to 5 Arrests, a Foiled Plot and a Paris-Brussels Connection
item.description: Najim Laachraoui, 24, who blew himself up at Brussels Airport, made two of the explosive vests used in the assaults on the French capital in November.
item.dc:creator: LILIA BLAISE and AURELIEN BREEDEN
item.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak for The New York Times
item.media:description: Police officers cleared a street in the Schaerbeek neighborhood of Brussels on Friday.

item.title: Security Risk: Belgium Fears Nuclear Plants Are Vulnerable
item.description: Belgian authorities fear that Islamic State militants may try to attack, infiltrate or sabotage nuclear plants or obtain nuclear or radioactive material.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: ALISSA J. RUBIN and MILAN SCHREUER
item.media:description: The nuclear power plant in Doel, Belgium. The country has a troubled history of security lapses at its nuclear power facilities.

item.title: A Top ISIS Leader Is Killed in an Airstrike, the Pentagon Says
item.description: The killing of Abd al-Rahman Mustafa al-Qaduli comes as the U.S. appears to be having increased success targeting the Islamic State’s leadership.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and MARK MAZZETTI
item.media:description: An undated photograph released by the United States State Department of Abd al-Rahman Mustafa al-Qaduli, an Islamic State leader.

item.title: Tribeca Film Festival to Screen Anti-Vaccination Movie
item.description: The decision to screen the film, which was directed by a former doctor whose medical license was revoked, has reignited an intense debate about autism and vaccines.
item.dc:creator: MELENA RYZIK and PAM BELLUCK
item.media:description: Robert De Niro and his wife, Grace Hightower, in January. Mr. De Niro, one of the festival’s founders, said in a statement that “we believe it is critical that all of the issues surrounding the causes of autism be openly discussed and examined.”

item.title: ISIS Suicide Bomber in Iraq Kills Dozens at Soccer Game
item.description: The police say the attack devastated a crowd in the town of Iskandariya, south of Baghdad, at a game sponsored by a powerful Shiite militia.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: OMAR AL-JAWOSHY

item.title: A Revived Challenge to Islam as Bangladesh’s State Religion Goes to Court
item.description: Amid rising concerns about extremism, a 28-year-old petition supporting secularism has been revived, and the country’s Supreme Court is to hear the challenge on Sunday.
item.dc:creator: MAHER SATTAR

item.title: Israel Begins Murder Investigation of Soldier Who Shot Palestinian
item.description: Video emerged showing a soldier shooting an assailant in the head as he lay on the road near a Jewish settlement in the West Bank city of Hebron.
item.dc:creator: DIAA HADID

item.title: A Dam, Small and Unsung, Is Caught Up in an Iranian Hacking Case
item.description: The Bowman Avenue Dam in Rye Brook, N.Y., may pale next to hydroelectric power generators, but its computerized sluice-gate drew the attention of the Iranians, the authorities say.
item.dc:creator: JOSEPH BERGER
item.media:credit: Christopher Capozziello for The New York Times
item.media:description: Westchester Avenue in Port Chester, N.Y., near a small computerized dam that the federal authorities say Iranian computer hackers tried to take control of.

item.title: After Brussels Attacks, a Slow Process to Confirm Families’ Worst Fears
item.description: Relatives around the world were still waiting for word about missing loved ones, prolonging the agony of those already suffering.
item.dc:creator: DAN BILEFSKY and RUSSELL GOLDMAN
item.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak for The New York Times
item.media:description: A memorial to the victims of the Brussels terror attacks, in which 31 people from 40 countries were killed.
